intro: Aloiampelos commixta, commonly known as the mixed aloiampelos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats and has hairy, narrow leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Aloiampelos commixta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
